trans-unit.source: Represents a list box control that allows single or multiple item selection.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Accessibility](#accessibility)
[Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax)
Introduction
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control to create a list control that allows single or multiple item selection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.Rows%2A> property to specify the height of the control.
To enable multiple item selection, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> property to `ListSelectionMode.Multiple`.

To specify the items that you want to appear in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control, place a `ListItem` element for each entry between the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection to examine the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

For example, you can determine the selected item(s) in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control by enumerating the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection and testing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> value for each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control also supports data binding.
To bind the control to a data source, first create a data source, such as one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceControl> objects, that contains the items to display in the control.
Next, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DataBind%2A> method to bind the data source to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataTextField%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.DataValueField%2A> properties to specify which field in the data source to bind to the `Text` and `Value` properties, respectively, of each list item in the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control will now display the information from the data source.
This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script.
Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application.
You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control.
ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input.

For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461).
Accessibility

For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> class.
Adds `name`, `size`, `multiple`, and `onchange` to the list of attributes to render.
The output stream that renders HTML content to the client.
Gets or sets the border color of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.BorderColor%2A> property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> object that represents the border color of the control.
Gets or sets the border style of the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.BorderStyle%2A> property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the border width for the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.BorderWidth%2A> property is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit"></xref> object that represents the border width of the control.
Gets the array of index values for currently selected items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.GetSelectedIndices%2A> method to identify or access the selected items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
Each element in the returned array represents the index for a selected list item.
You can use the index values to access the items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection.
An array of integers, each representing the index of a selected item in the list box.
Loads the posted content of the list control, if it is different from the last posting.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A> method is used primarily by control developers, when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates if the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control has changed.
In other words, it determines if each list item in the control has the same <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> value as the last posted value.

A user selecting an item in the control changes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> value for the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
If some list items are selected in the control, or if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> is disabled, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A> returns `false`.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A> method returns `true` for a control, the ASP.NET page framework invokes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method for the control.
The key identifier for the control, used to index the postCollection.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> that contains value information indexed by control identifiers.
`true` if the posted content is different from the last posting; otherwise, `false`.
Configures the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control prior to rendering on the client.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.OnPreRender%2A> method is used primarily by control developers, when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.OnPreRender%2A> method allows derived classes to handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender> event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.OnPreRender%2A> method performs any necessary prerendering steps prior to saving view state and rendering content for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox>.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event data.

Invokes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method whenever posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is used primarily by control developers, when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

The ASP.NET page framework calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A> method indicates that the state of the list items have changed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event.
Control developers can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged%2A> method to perform custom processing when the user selects list items in the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method can optionally perform validation before raising the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event for the control.

To validate a group of controls on the page when a list item within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> is selected, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.AutoPostBack%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.CausesValidation%2A> properties to `true`, and then specify the group of controls to validate in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.ValidationGroup%2A> property.
Gets or sets the number of rows displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.Rows%2A> property to specify the number of rows to display in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
The number of rows must be between one and 2000.
Values outside of this range will raise an exception.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.Rows%2A> property is stored in view state.
The number of rows displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control.
The default value is `4`.
The specified number of rows is less than one or greater than 2000.
Gets or sets the selection mode of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> property to specify the mode behavior of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.

Setting this property to `ListSelectionMode.Single` indicates only a single item can be selected from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control, while `ListSelectionMode.Multiple` specifies multiple items can be selected.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.SelectionMode%2A> property is stored in view state.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListSelectionMode"></xref> values.
The default value is `Single`.
The specified selection mode is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListSelectionMode"></xref> values.
Loads the posted content of the list control, if it is different from the last posting.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to process posted data for changes to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.System%23Web%23UI%23IPostBackDataHandler%23LoadPostData%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The index within the posted collection that references the content to load.
The collection posted to the server.
`true` if the posted content is different from the last posting; otherwise, `false`.

Invokes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.OnSelectedIndexChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method whenever posted data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox"></xref> control has changed.

Typically, you should use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to raise an event when the posted data for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> object changes.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox.System%23Web%23UI%23IPostBackDataHandler%23LoadPostData%2A> method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
